intro: Vangueria oxyantha, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant produces small, star-shaped white or pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Vangueria oxyantha is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
